page.title: 15ATTITUDES
page.content: There are a number of concerns which merit noting. They are, in the main, typical village issues... 1) That there are not adequate bus services connecting Rhoose with major towns. 2)That sending children to secondary schools nine miles away cannot be avoided but it is a problem nonetheless. 3)That there is a regular amount of "fallout" emitted by the Aberthaw Cement Works and Quarry which coats anything (washing, cars etc.) left out overnight. 4)That local council provision for amenities etc. is dictated by the amount of money provided by the Vale of Glamorgan Borough Council and that this council has not enough interest in the outlying areas such as Rhoose.
